biotools.summary: Detects structural variation (SV) breakpoints by clustering discordant paired-end alignments whose “signatures” corroborate the same putative breakpoint. It can detect breakpoints caused by all classes of structural variation. Moreover, it was designed to detect variation in both unique and duplicated genomic regions; therefore, it will examine paired-end reads having multiple discordant alignments.
